attributes.action: Allow wedding ceremonies and receptions for 15 people by the end of April 2021
attributes.additional_details: The wedding industry has taken a huge hit during the pandemic with many businesses failing. People have rescheduled their wedding several times already due to restrictions which is not only loosing them alot of money but also affecting their mental health. The risk of transmission with responsible adults maintaining social distancing and sitting in their bubbles for a sit down meal is far less than classrooms filled with children. This change will improve mental health and improve our economy.
attributes.background: Allow wedding ceremonies and receptions for at least 15 people regardless of tiers as soon as we are out of national lockdown with measures such as social distancing, bubble seating arrangements, mask use and a sit down meal not buffets.

rejection.details: Since you started your petition the Government has announced that the the number of people able to attend weddings and receptions will rise to 15 as Step 2 of its roadmap for easing Covid-19 restrictions. The Government has said this will happen no earlier than 12 April: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/covid-19-response-spring-2021/covid-19-response-spring-2021-summary
